did.unittitle: Richard Henry Stoddard, New York, to Andrew Varick Stout Anthony, New York

scopecontent.p: [Asks him to have the third volume of Thackeray sent to him; says he got the first and second volumes weeks ago.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Stoddard, New York, to Andrew Varick Stout Anthony, New York

scopecontent.p: [Discusses Thackeray; asks him to inquire about his wife's periodicals which have stopped coming.]

did.unittitle: Richard Henry Stoddard, New York, to Andrew Varick Stout Anthony, New York

scopecontent.p: [Attempts to find out from Anthony what the [J. Henry] Harper, [Stephen Ryder] Fiske, [Thomas] Hardyagreement on the dramatization of Tess of the D'Urbervillesis; says that his son, Lorimer Stoddard, who is sick in a sanitorium in New York, dramatized the novel and gave Fiske the right to present it in England; says that Fiske refuses, or neglects, to enlighten Lorimer; Stoddard says he would not betray confidence.]
